title: Allergen Control
description: Comprehensive allergen management requirements including allergen identification, segregation, cleaning procedures, labeling accuracy, cross-contact prevention, and allergen control program documentation

requirements.question: Does the operation handle or store any food allergens? Information gathering question
Are there adequate storage controls (e.g., separation, identification, etc.) that ensure that allergens are not contaminating other raw materials?
Is there a dedicated allergen production line or adequate clean down and production procedures that prevent allergen cross contamination?
Are utensils and work in progress storage containers identified in order to prevent allergen cross contamination?
Does re-work handling take into account the issues associated with allergen containing products?

Are workers trained with respect to allergen risks and the facility allergen cross contamination controls (including hand washing between production runs) and are there records of this allergen training?
Are worker practices adequate and being followed to protect against allergen cross-contact and against contamination of food?
Are all products manufactured on site labeled correctly with respect to allergens?
